title: Killer dad battered three week-old baby son to death for having a ‘bad attitude’
text:
Erik Sherman, pictured left during a court appearance, fatally battered his three week-old son Emmett to death for having a bad attitude at his home in Spokane, right (Pictures: KHQ/Google Maps)

A father battered his newborn baby son to death for having a ‘bad attitude,’ leaving the boy with a mouth so damaged he couldn’t eat.

Erik Sherman, 34, is set to spend up to 26 years in jail after admitting the homicide by abuse of Emmett Sherman in August 2018.

Baby Emmett, who lived in Spokane, Washington, suffered a torn lip, black eyes, cuts to his face and a fractured collar bone after being battered by his dad.

Sherman was heard screaming at the newborn before his death, telling him ‘he didn’t like his attitude.’

Emmett’s mother told police she also heard Sherman yelling: ‘that he did not care how old he is. He needs to stop crying.’

That rant is said to have continued for 45 minutes, KHQ reported.

Boy, 2, nearly died after being savaged by venomous snake

Emmett’s mother woke up on the morning of August 5 last year and found her young son’s mouth bleeding so badly he was unable to eat.

She and Sherman then waited two days before taking Emmett to hospital after he stopped breathing while she was feeding him.

They tried to diagnose the baby’s illness using Google.

A doctor at Providence Sacred Heart Medical Center called Emmett’s injuries ‘one of the worst cases of child abuse he had seen in 23 years of practice,’ according to the Spokesman Review.

Emmett died on August 10 2018, and was found to have died of a subdural hemorrhage of the brain caused by a blunt impact.

Sherman initially tried to claim that his baby son had sustained the horrific injuries after rocking his head forward suddenly and hitting his dad’s shoulder.

He is said to have told Emmett’s mother that the infant’s other scratches had been self-inflicted while sleeping in his crib.

The baby’s mother, who was not named, was not charged with any crime.

Sherman will be sentenced on November 15, with a plea deal meaning he will spend no more than 26 years behind bars.
description: Erik Sherman battered his three week-old son Emmett so badly the baby's mouth was too damaged for him to be able to eat
